channel.title: reading on sneaky-potato
channel.description: Recent content in reading on sneaky-potato

item.title: Year 2038 problem
item.description: Classic buffer overflow bug Most computer systems measure unix time- the number of seconds elapsed since the Unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) – and store it in a signed 32-bit integer However the data type can only store numbers from -(231) and (232 - 1) (random trivia: this number is the eighth Mersenne prime).

item.title: Internet Census 2012
item.description: Super fast distributed port scanner Just search up Carna botnet and you’ll be presented with a picture of world map.

item.title: Paul Graham and his essays
item.description: More reading material Paul Graham best known for his work on Lisp or his former startup Viaweb (later renamed Yahoo!
